comments: Construct a graph as follows: form the graph whose adjacency matrix is the tensor product of that of P_3 and [1,1;1,1], then add a loop at each of the extremity nodes. a(n-1) counts walks of length n between adjacent nodes. - _Paul Barry_, Nov 12 2004The compositions of n  in which each natural number is colored by one of  p different colors are called p-colored compositions of n.  For n>=2, 9*a(n-2) equals the number of 9-colored compositions of n with all parts >=2, such that no adjacent parts have the same color. - _Milan Janjic_, Nov 26 2011Pisano period lengths:  1, 1, 6, 1, 24, 6, 16, 1, 6, 24,110, 6, 56, 16, 24, 2, 16, 6, 60, 24,... - _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 10 2012
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
M. Janjic, On Linear Recurrence Equations Arising from Compositions of Positive Integers, 2014; http://matinf.pmfbl.org/wp-content/uploads/2015/01/za-arhiv-18.-1.pdf
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (1,8)
prog: (Sage) [lucas_number1(n,1,-8) for n in xrange(1, 27)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Apr 22 2009(MAGMA) [ n eq 1 select 1 else n eq 2 select 1 else Self(n-1)+8*Self(n-2): n in [1..30] ]; // Vincenzo Librandi, Aug 23 2011(PARI) a(n)=Vec(1/(1-x-8*x^2)+O(x^99)) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Feb 03 2014
author: _Olivier Gérard_
